Doherty to Pietersen, 1 run an elegant extra cover drive to end the over
Bollinger to Pietersen, 2 wide a bouncer from Bollinger, way over Pietersen's head, Haddin jumps and tries to collect with one outstretched hand, gets glove on it but can't prevent the bye
Bollinger to Yardy, no run another short one, Yardy mistimes another pull, lands short of mid-on
Bollinger to Yardy, 1 run back of length and outside off, dabbed towards third man for a single
Bollinger to Pietersen, 1 run a knee-high full toss outside off, KP mistimes a drive to mid-off
Bollinger to Yardy, OUT finally Yardy perishes to the pull, he has mishit several of them today, this time he gets hold of it and it carries only as far as Michael Hussey at deep midwicket
Bollinger to Pietersen, no run short of length ball on middle and leg, Pietersen hit on the thigh pad as he looks to defend
Bollinger to Pietersen, no run similar length from Bolinger, on middle, Pietersen punches it back towards the bowler
Watson to Bresnan, no run a swish-and-miss from Bresnan to a ball outside off
Watson to Bresnan, no run short of length ball outside off, mistimes a pull towards midwicket
Watson to Bresnan, FOUR runs a bit of width, Bresnan goes after it hard, gets a n edge that flies past the keeper to the third man boundary
Watson to Bresnan, no run another attempted powerful hit from Bresnan, he looks to crash the ball past extra cover, no contact
Watson to Bresnan, 2 runs short ball from Hussey, Bresnan goes for the pull, connects well finally, Michael Hussey has work to do in the deep
Watson to Bresnan, no run pitchd up and just outside off, driven towards mid-off by Bresnan
Bollinger to Pietersen, 1 run short of length outside off, KP hits it towards cover
Bollinger to Bresnan, 1 run short of length ball on middle and off, defended to the off side
Bollinger to Pietersen, 1 run similar length on the legstump, 'catch' is the cry but the only man who could have is the square-leg umpire
Bollinger to Bresnan, 2 runs shortish ball just outside off, makes a bit of room and slaps that down to third man
Bollinger to Bresnan, 1 run back of a length ball around off, Bresnan makes room and gets an outside edge towards third man
Bollinger to Pietersen, 1 run good-looking shot, but not very well timed, all along the ground past the bowler
Watson to Pietersen, 1 run driven down to long-on for a single to bring up the 250 for England
Watson to Bresnan, no run defended back towards the bowler by Bresnan
Watson to Bresnan, 1 run length ball on middle and leg, tucked towards midwicket
Watson to Pietersen, 1 run Pietersen walks across the stumps and drives a length ball towards sweeper cover
Watson to Bresnan, no run Bresnan backs away and chops the ball towards point
Watson to Bresnan, no run length ball is pushed back towards the bowler
Johnson to Pietersen, 1 run full and wide, cracked towards cover
Johnson to Bresnan, FOUR runs length ball just outside off, smoked down the ground for four
Johnson to Bresnan, no run length ball outside off, Bresnan mistimes a cover drive

Johnson to Bresnan, OUT superb work from Johnson, Pietersen's run-out, massive blow for England, Johnson might be having a tough time with the ball, but don't question his footballing skills, he bangs in a short ball, Bresnan looks to pull it, he misses and the ball hits him on the chest and rolls to the leg side, KP is very keen on a single and calls Bresnan though, Johnson races towards the ball and right-foots it onto the stumps, catching
Johnson to Swann, no run length ball outside off, Swann slices that towards backward point
Johnson to Swann, no run slower ball from Johnson, short and wide but Swann can't connect
Lee to Bresnan, no run powered to extra cover, that was overpitched outside off, can't get it past the fielder

Lee to Bresnan, OUT short and outside off, Bresnan looks to slash that one, gets a top-edge which sails to Doherty at third man, Lee is thrilled as he thought he had Davies caught at third man earlier before replays showed he had overstepped, no such worries this time
Lee to Swann, 1 run full and well outside off, sliced down to third man
Lee to Shahzad, no run short ball outside off, Shahzad jumps as the ball rises but doesn't offer a shot, that was a quick delivery
Lee to Shahzad, 1 run this was the slower bouncer, Shahzad mistimes the pull, the ball lands short of deep midwicket
Lee to Swann, 2 wide fired down the leg side by Lee, batsman looks to tickle it to fine leg but misses
Lee to Shahzad, no run came down the track and blocked it back to the bowler
Johnson to Swann, 1 run full and just outside off, jabbed past backward point by Swann, one run short says the umpire so England get only a single
Johnson to Swann, 1 run length ball again well outside off, Swann drags it towards mid-on
Johnson to Shahzad, 1 leg bye Shahzad backs away, Johnson follows him and the batsman is struck on the pad and the ball rolls towards square leg
Johnson to Swann, no run slower ball angling away, Swann can't connect

Johnson to Swann, OUT and another catch for Doherty, can England play out the 50 overs? there have inly one wicket left now as Swann holes out, a slower ball from Johnson, Swann looks to clear the in-field but can't chip it past Doherty at mid-on
Johnson to Shahzad, no run on middle and leg, batsman gets behind the line and defends

Lee to Bresnan, no run short and wide slower ball from Lee to start, Bresnan cuts that hard to Smith at cover, Swann sets off for a single, David Hussey dives to do the backing up after the throw from Smith misses
Lee to Bresnan, 1 run
Lee to Swann, 1 run shortish ball outside leg, batsman was backing away early, helped towards midwicket for a single

Lee to Bresnan, FOUR runs slower bouncer from Lee, Bresnan doesn't pick it up, he was early into his attempted hook, adjusts late and gets it off the toe-end towards fine leg, gets enough on it to get a boundary
Lee to Bresnan, 1 run pushed just wide of Brett Lee to get a single
Lee to Swann, no run Swann goes for an ambitious swipe to a short of length ball just outside off, he misses and the ball zips through to the keeper
Johnson to Bresnan, no run Johnson starts the over with a full and wide delivery, Bresnan looks to crash that through cover, but doesn't make contact
Johnson to Bresnan, no run crowd are excited as Bresnan thumps a short ball back towards the bowler, mistimed and Johnson does well to field
Johnson to Bresnan, 2 runs Bresnan swipes this one down the ground, Swann pushes him to come back for the second
Johnson to Bresnan, FOUR runs Johnson gets the line totally wrong, outside leg and Bresnan clips that nicely behind square, well timed that
Johnson to Bresnan, 1 run fullish ball outside off, muscled towards sweeper cover
Johnson to Swann, no run bouncer down the leg side, batsman had backed away a long way, he tries to jab that past the keeper to third man but can't get bat on it
Lee to Tremlett, no run Lee nearly finishes the innings with a pinpoint yorker, Tremlett does well to keep that out

Lee to Tremlett, no run the review system is being used for the first time in ODIs, Australia have asked for it after Shahzad is struck on the back pad outside leg and goes through to the keeper, Lee think there's an inside-edge and asks for a caught-behind, replays don't show a nick, there were two noises as the ball flicked the front pad before thudding into the back pad, Tremlett survives
Lee to Tremlett, no run another yorker, outside off, Tremlett can't get bat on it
Lee to Tremlett, no run Lee keeps chruning out the yorker,best delivery to the tailender, this one was heading for middle and off, Tremlett defends
Lee to Tremlett, 1 bye this was short from Lee, Tremlett ducks, he is called through for a bye, the batsmen scramble one, Lee lucky that wasn't called a wide since the bouncer was down leg
Lee to Shahzad, SIX runs whoah! Lee attempts a yorker again, just gets is wrong, Shahzad gets under that one and launches over mid-off, plenty of power behind that shot and that goes on for a six
Johnson to Tremlett, 1 run length ball heading for middle, Tremlett makes room and slaps it towards mid-on
Johnson to Shahzad, 1 run short ball on legstump, swung down to Watson at fine leg

Johnson to Tremlett, SIX runs another biggie, this time from Tremlett, a massive six, shortish ball outside leg, Tremlett made room and swiped that with incredible power, sends the ball soaring over midwicket
Johnson to Tremlett, 1 wide another of those crazy Johnson deliveries, miles down the leg side

Johnson to Tremlett, OUT the end of the innings, Tremlett had cleared the front leg to attempt another monster hit, it was a short of length ball from Johnson, takes the top edge and goes through at a nice height to Haddin

So England finish on 294, perhaps they would have expected more after the start they got. The openers had plenty of lives but maintained a punishing rate; only KP made a big contribution after the openers departed though and England couldn't reach the 300 they seemed set to get. It was a wonderful innings from KP, controlled initially before bringing out the big hits against the spinners. The slow bowlers are expected to get some help in the second

Right, we're all set for the second half of this game. Shane Watson is marking his guard as England's fielders scatter across the MCG. Brad Haddin is up at the other end, and it'll be Tim Bresnan to open the bowling for England.
Bresnan to Watson, no run nice and straight to start, good length too. Coming in gently off the seam, and Watson steps forward to defend to mid-on
Bresnan to Watson, FOUR runs Watson is away! Too straight from Bresnan, slipping towards leg stump and Watson just had to get a touch on it - fine leg is very square
Bresnan to Watson, no run full again, but outside off this time and Watson aims a crunchy drive right at mid-off
Bresnan to Watson, no run cracked square on the drive this time, Morgan fields nicely on the bounce
Bresnan to Watson, 2 runs delicate late cut from Watson, but Yardy's fielding down at third man is just as good and saves two runs
Bresnan to Watson, no run shaping gently away through the air, Watson steps well forward and drives into the covers
Tremlett to Haddin, 1 run full and shaping away to start - this was quite wide and went even further. A thick outside edge bounces down to third man
Tremlett to Watson, FOUR runs slap! Wide again, and short this time. Watson cashes in with a flashing cut that beats a diving point and also evades third man
Tremlett to Watson, no run that's better from Tremlett, he straightens his line and Watson stays deep in the crease to defend back down the track
Tremlett to Watson, no run Watto is looking to impose himself early here, lunging forward to drive hard into the covers. He finds the fielder, however
Tremlett to Watson, no run great length from Tremlett, drawing the batsman forward but extracting enough bounce to hit the splice as Watson defends to extra cover
Tremlett to Watson, 1 run slightly wider of off, Watson steps forward and runs it off the face of the blade down to third man
Bresnan to Watson, no run flung down on a length, but outside off and easily left alone. Not a great deal of movement on offer for the quicks so far

Bresnan to Watson, FOUR runs cracking drive! Watson is great to watch when he's in this sort of form, he strides confidently down the pitch and slams a technically perfect drive through the covers. Power and placement.
Bresnan to Watson, 2 runs clipped down to third man, they push hard and that's well run for two
Bresnan to Watson, no run Bresnan adjusts his line, attacking the stumps, and Watson defends

Bresnan to Watson, no run Watson's just tried to make too much of this, it was short and wide and there to be hit but he tried to smash it too hard and ends up hitting it hard into the ground and straight to point
Bresnan to Watson, 1 run a thick inside edge thumps into the pad and rolls to leg, and Watson will keep the strike as they scamper through for one
Tremlett to Watson, FOUR runs a handsome straight drive! Tremlett goes full and Watson is parked on the front foot waiting for the ball, the left elbow leads the shot and mid-on has no chance
Tremlett to Watson, no run Tremlett pulls the length back, Watson defends to cover with a hop
Tremlett to Watson, 1 run properly short this time from the bowler, Watson rocks back and pulls out into the deep - but there's a man out there, Pietersen, to stop the boundary
Tremlett to Haddin, 1 run Haddin faces up to just his second ball, nudging a full delivery just wide of mid-on for a quick single
Tremlett to Watson, no run Watson drops a back-of-a-length delivery close in on the off side and briefly considers a cheeky single, but the fielder is in too quickly
Tremlett to Watson, 1 run nicely done, not a great deal of width to work with as the ball lands on a length on off stump, but Watson just stays on leg stump and glides it down to third man for one
Bresnan to Watson, no run tight, length delivery right on middle and off. Watson defends

Bresnan to Watson, FOUR runs Watson is in top form here, hitting the ball just where he wants to. The slip fielder had just been moved - Strauss it was - and so Watson aims a delicate late cut right through that region, beating Pietersen at third man for a boundary
Bresnan to Watson, 1 run hmm, and he follows that up with a much more awkward-looking chop down to that third man fielder. Still, gets the job done and that's a single

Bresnan to Haddin, no run well, the batsman steps away to leg and swings mightily at a length delivery outside off - hitting only fresh air. It was the cross-seamed delivery from Bresnan, and it gripped a touch on the wicket and moved away from the bat
Bresnan to Haddin, 1 run slower ball this time, but picked by Haddin who nudges into the leg side for one
Bresnan to Watson, no run Bresnan hones in on a good length, Watson defends
Tremlett to Haddin, no run Tremlett charges in and seems to put a bit more effort into this one, finding significant lift off the wicket as Haddin hangs back and defends to point
Tremlett to Haddin, no run and Haddin picks out gully exactly, chopping it straight to Strauss on the bounce
Tremlett to Haddin, 3 runs nice little shot from Haddin, as Tremlett slips too full and too straight and is worked out to deep midwicket
Tremlett to Watson, no run Tremlett lets one go with a grunt and finds a good length on off stump. Played down to gully. He's looking for third man with the shot
Tremlett to Watson, no run slower ball from Tremlett, Watson was early stepping forward but re-adjusted quickly and cracked the full delivery to point
Tremlett to Watson, 2 runs short, pulled hard out towards wide midwicket but Pietersen charges across and tumbles over to save the boundary. Great fielding. Good field placement for Watson too
Shahzad to Haddin, no run good start, hitting a length and moving in to the right-hander, who steps back and defends
Shahzad to Haddin, no run Haddin gives himself some room but Shahzad's rhythm isn't disturbed and he aims a length ball at the off stump. Tapped to cover
Shahzad to Haddin, no run dropped down close on the off side, there's no run to be had as the fielder swoops
Shahzad to Haddin, no run back of a length from Shahzad, he keeps Haddin deep in the crease as the ball is defended towards mid-on
Shahzad to Haddin, 1 run short and wider of off stump this time, Haddin doesn't take full toll, just pushing it down to third man
Shahzad to Watson, no run Shahzad attacks middle and off on a good length, Watson defends watchfully to mid-on

Tremlett to Haddin, no run Haddin looks decidedly nervy out there, again he steps away to leg and tries to slash up and over the off side field ... but is beaten on the outside edge by a touch of extra bounce

Tremlett to Haddin, FOUR runs lucky! Haddin backs away and aims an uncertain poke at a back-of-a-length delivery, a thick inside edge rolls wide of fine leg and that's four. Wasn't too far away from the stumps though
Tremlett to Haddin, no run for the third time Haddin steps to leg, this time drilling it hard to mid-off
Tremlett to Haddin, 1 leg bye back of a length, the ball comes off Haddin's hip and they nip through for a leg bye
Tremlett to Watson, 2 runs worked off the pad, behind square on the leg side and they're back for the second
Tremlett to Watson, 3 runs just short of a good length, Watson steps back and pulls out into the deep but Pietersen is there to cut the shot off
Shahzad to Watson, no run good slower ball from Shahzad, but Watson spots it and defends
Shahzad to Watson, no run just outside off this time, again it's slower through the air, tapped to point. That was the legcutter, he just ran the fingers over the ball and got it to grip a touch
Shahzad to Watson, no run fuller and quicker, Watson aims a cautious drive straight to mid-on
Shahzad to Watson, 2 runs curving in through the air, but the ball starts too wide of off and Watson is able to punch out to deep point for a couple
Shahzad to Watson, no run slower again, much slower this time. For a moment it appeared as though Watson was going to have a heave at this, but he just held himself back and opted for defence instead

Shahzad to Watson, SIX runs this time he does have a go, and slams it in some style into the crowd behind long-on! It was another slower ball from Shahzad, but too full. That was a 101-metre six, quite a monster
Tremlett to Haddin, 1 run cramping the batsman for room, the ball is tapped into the leg side

Tremlett to Watson, 2 runs a top-edged pull, the ball swirls up, hanging in the air for an age ... and it's dropped by Trott, running back from mid-on! It was a really tough chance, he leapt back trying to take it over his shoulder but just got a hand to it and couldn't hold on
Tremlett to Watson, no run chopped down to gully
Tremlett to Watson, 1 run swatted out into the deep on the leg side, an aggressive front-foot pull from the batsman
Tremlett to Haddin, 1 run just short of a good length, Haddin steps across to off and nudges to midwicket for a quick single
Tremlett to Watson, 1 run whipped off the front pad and out into the leg side, and that's the first Powerplay done
Yardy to Watson, no run pushed to mid-off
Yardy to Watson, 1 run Yardy, coming round the wicket, fires one in at leg stump and is clipped to midwicket. Shahzad sprints across and does really well to prevent the second run
Yardy to Haddin, 1 run looped up much slower, full on leg stump, and Haddin drives down to long-on
Yardy to Watson, 1 run nudged just wide of midwicket, and that's fifty for Shane Watson. His team really need him to stick around and play through the innings
Yardy to Haddin, 1 run flicked out to deep square leg for one
Yardy to Watson, 1 run and worked out into the leg side once more
Swann to Watson, 1 run punched down to long-on for one
Swann to Haddin, 1 run a hint of turn for Swann, but it's slow turn and easily negotiated by Haddin, tapped into the leg side
Swann to Watson, no run tossed up on a perfect length outside off, Watson steps forward and defends with bat and pad right together
Swann to Watson, 2 runs just a bit too short from Swann, Watson rocks back and pulls hard out to deep midwicket
Swann to Watson, no run floated down outside off, Watson gets back and across and defends to cover
Swann to Watson, 1 run slightly too wide of off, Watson glides one just wide of short third man and they scamper through
Yardy to Watson, no run speared at leg stump, flicked to short fine leg
Yardy to Watson, 1 run held back a touch, the ball grips and spins slowly away. Watson stays deep in the crease and punches hard to mid-off. They sprint through for one
Yardy to Haddin, 1 run eased down to long-on
Yardy to Watson, 1 run singles on offer here, Watson pushing down to long-off
Yardy to Haddin, no run much slower through the air, Haddin defends
Yardy to Haddin, 1 run driven out to deep cover, he sliced at it a touch but played along the ground and in the gap
Bresnan to Haddin, FOUR runs Haddin begins with a boundary! Stepping away to leg to a length delivery, he uses the resultant width to crack a cut shot out to the boundary
Bresnan to Haddin, no run fuller and straighter from Bresnan, Haddin taps slightly awkwardly to midwicket
Bresnan to Haddin, no run again Haddin gives himself room, forcing off the back foot but straight to the point fielder this time
Bresnan to Haddin, no run slower ball from Bresnan, giving Haddin no width to work with and he's quietly defended to mid-on
Bresnan to Haddin, 1 run sharp running! That was pretty close, nudged to gully and they just set off despite the fielder there. The throw was just wide, he might have been struggling otherwise
Bresnan to Watson, FOUR runs bad line from Bresnan, and he's punished for it, glanced down to fine leg for four
Shahzad to Haddin, FOUR runs slapped to the long-on boundary! Haddin steps away and Shahzad follows him, but it's full and invites a shot. A firm thump flies wide of mid-on and races over the rope

Shahzad to Haddin, FOUR runs up and over extra cover this time! Shahzad went full, Haddin backed away and scooped the drive over the infield. The ball slows up on the outfield but has just enough on it to get over the line

Shahzad to Haddin, 1 run to mid-off on the bounce this time! Haddin was lining up another big shot and but just went too early at this one, driving in the air but dropping short of mid-off, and they steal a single
Shahzad to Watson, 1 run nudged just wide of midwicket
Shahzad to Haddin, no run Haddin plays from outside leg stump, but it's a defensive stroke back to the bowler
Shahzad to Haddin, no run great fielding by Bell at extra cover! It was driven hard into the ground to his right, but he leapt across to cut the shot off cleanly
Yardy to Watson, 1 run round the wicket he comes, landing the ball on middle and leg and Watson flicks out to deep midwicket
Yardy to Haddin, no run quick and aimed at middle stump, Haddin defends back to the bowler
Yardy to Haddin, no run Yardy slips towards leg stump but Haddin's shot goes straight to midwicket
Yardy to Haddin, no run Yardy continues to tuck him up quite nicely, no width to work with
Yardy to Haddin, no run nice and straight again, arrowed at middle and Haddin can only defend back to the bowler
Yardy to Haddin, no run and more defence to finish the over - a good one for Yardy and for England
Bresnan to Watson, no run a good length delivery, seaming in towards off stump, is defended back to the bowler
Bresnan to Watson, no run pushed down the leg side, the ball flicks the thigh pad and it takes a good, diving effort from Davies behind the stumps to cut that off
Bresnan to Watson, 2 runs heaved across the line and out into the leg side, Trott runs across and hurls in the return, falling over as he does so, but can't prevent the two
Bresnan to Watson, no run inside edge, and the ball rolls just past the stumps! It was the slower ball from Bresnan
Bresnan to Watson, no run quicker and shorter, beating Watson for pace and striking him on the hip
Bresnan to Watson, 1 run chopped down to gully, and they take the chance for a quick single
Yardy to Watson, no run tossed up on middle, a bit of inside edge and a bit of pad gets 'keeper and bowler interested, but there's no appeal
Yardy to Watson, 1 run driven down to long-off, there's the 100. This is also, incidentally, Haddin and Watson's best opening stand for Australia
Yardy to Haddin, 1 run Haddin comes down the track and drives to long-off
Yardy to Watson, no run slightly too wide, cut but straight to point
Yardy to Watson, no run a toe-ended drive rolls into the covers
Yardy to Watson, 1 run pushed just to the left of mid-on, there's a call for the run straight away and the sprint through
Shahzad to Watson, 1 run full on off stump, dug out towards mid-off

Shahzad to Haddin, no run good shape away from the bat this time, that hasn't happened too often today. Possibly the legcutter once more, as the ball nips past the outside edge. As he has done all innings, Haddin had backed away to leg
Shahzad to Haddin, no run fuller and straighter, defended to cover
Shahzad to Haddin, no run a checked drive this time, again the ball goes to extra cover on the bounce
Shahzad to Haddin, FOUR runs outside edge, genuine edge, and through the vacant slip region for four! Well wide of Davies, he had no chance
Shahzad to Haddin, no run testing over from Shahzad, this time he fires in a yorker outside off and the ball nips right under the bat as Haddin jabs down at it. Through to the 'keeper
Swann to Watson, no run short from Swann, Watson was back and waiting for the aggressive pull but the ball just skidded through low to beat the bottom edge and land in Davies' gloves
Swann to Watson, 1 run Watson stays back again and punches wide of mid-off this time
Swann to Haddin, 2 runs just a bit too short, nice shot from Haddin, delicately late-cut down to third man. Yardy chases the ball down
Swann to Clarke, no run well forward to start, driving to cover
Swann to Clarke, 1 run Clarke skips down, getting nicely to the pitch and driving down to long-off
Shahzad to Clarke, no run a nervous, airy waft outside off from Clarke. The ball hit the seam and jagged away from him, beating the outside edge
Shahzad to Clarke, no run tipped defensively towards point
Shahzad to Clarke, no run now, is this ball starting to reverse? It certainly appears so, this one snakes in through the air as Clarke drives back down the track.
Shahzad to Clarke, 1 run this one goes the other way, a sharp reversing outswinger! The ball takes the outside half of the bat and bounces behind point
Shahzad to Watson, no run slower ball this time, Watson steps well forward and defends square
Shahzad to Watson, no run sliced slightly by Watson, on the drive, but along the ground to extra cover
Swann to Clarke, no run arm ball from Swann, it was much too short but Clarke couldn't do anything with it, his cut shot beaten on the top edge
Swann to Clarke, no run down the pitch, and the ball is chipped just short of midwicket! Scratchy stuff from Clarke
Swann to Clarke, no run he's down the track again, this time pushing back to the bowler
Swann to Clarke, 1 run chopped down to gully, quick single taken
Swann to Watson, no run a flicked drive goes straight to midwicket
Swann to Watson, FOUR runs ah, that ruins what had been a really good over! Speared down the leg side, Davies can't do anything about that and that's four
Shahzad to Clarke, no run Clarke is turned inside out by an outswinging, dipping low full-toss, popping it back to the bowler who fields in his follow through
Shahzad to Clarke, no run just short of a good length, Clarke is back and defending
Shahzad to Clarke, no run swinging out once again, the ball is full and wide and inviting the drive. Driven hard but straight to mid-off
Shahzad to Clarke, no run definite swing for Shahzad, Clarke isn't quite sure which way it's going to go and is squared up as he pushes to mid-off
Shahzad to Clarke, 1 run this one hoops in through the air, Clarke taps just wide of point and they sprint through
Shahzad to Watson, 1 run inswing again, but it comes out as a half-volley and Watson pushes to deep mid-off for one
Swann to Watson, no run drift through the air for Swann, and as the ball rushes through he beats the outside edge! There's an appeal from the bowler, but that hasn't hit anything
Swann to Watson, 1 run turning in from outside off, cut out to deep point
Swann to Clarke, 1 run pulled across from outside off, down to long-on for one
Swann to Watson, no run full on off stump, flighted quite nicely and Watson drives back to the bowler
Swann to Watson, no run tossed up again by Swann, even slower this time, and again it goes back to the bowler
Swann to Watson, no run flicked to midwicket to end the over
Tremlett to Clarke, 1 leg bye loosener on leg stump to start, nudged to short fine leg for a scampered single, off the thigh
Tremlett to Watson, no run on a length and straight, Watson plays back when he might have been forward, but taps to mid-on safely enough
Tremlett to Watson, 1 leg bye fired at leg stump, Watson misses an attempted glance but they take a leg bye off the pad
Tremlett to Clarke, 1 run worked off the hip into the leg side
Tremlett to Watson, 1 run full and straight, driven down the ground for one
Tremlett to Clarke, no run Clarke lines up a front foot pull, but a thick inside edge cannons off the pad and - luckily for him - rolls wide of the stumps
Swann to Watson, no run floated up temptingly on off stump, solid defence from the batsman

Swann to Watson, FOUR runs Australia needed a boundary to keep things under control, and Watson has provided it! Slog sweep from him, well in front of square, and out to straight midwicket. He cramps up after playing the shot, wincing in pain, which isn't a good sign
Swann to Watson, no run Swann pulls the length back a touch and is quicker through the air, defended
Swann to Watson, 1 run pushed out to long-off for one
Swann to Clarke, 1 run Clarke dances out and takes the ball on the full, pushing down to long-on for one

Swann to Watson, 1 run a flat-footed swipe from Watson, it's chipped in the air towards long-off ... but bounces just short of Tremlett! Watson is starting to look a bit weary here, and is targeting the boundary
Tremlett to Watson, 2 runs glanced off the pad and out to deep square leg, they push hard for the second and Watson is strugging ... but he's back in time! The throw is also just wide, which helps
Tremlett to Watson, 1 run tapped down to gully
Tremlett to Clarke, no run slower ball from Tremlett, or it's slightly slower through the air at any rate - the offcutter perhaps? Flicked straight to midwicket by Clarke
Tremlett to Clarke, 1 run short, Clarke's weight is forward but he pulls nicely down to fine leg, a controlled shot
Tremlett to Watson, no run tapped down just to Morgan's left at point, they think about the single but the fielder is round in a flash and hurling in a shy at the stumps
Tremlett to Watson, no run bursting past the outside edge! That moved appreciably off the seam
Swann to Clarke, 1 run pushed just behind square off the front foot
Swann to Watson, no run Watson is on the front foot, driving to cover
Swann to Watson, no run slightly too short, but skidding on and Watson can only nudge to midwicket
Swann to Watson, 1 run quicker one from Swann, pushed to the left of midwicket ... who slides but can't quite cut it off, a single is taken
Swann to Clarke, 1 run driven rather more firmly down to long-on
Swann to Watson, no run flat on off stump, Watson stays back and punches back to the bowler
Yardy to Clarke, 1 run touch too short to start, forced out to deep cover
Yardy to Watson, no run arrowed down flat on leg stump, Watson flicks but finds square leg
Yardy to Watson, 2 runs very quick through the air, really darted, but too wide down leg this time and Watson glances down to fine leg
Yardy to Watson, FOUR runs heaved out to the straight midwicket boundary! Not the slog sweep, though he was down on one knee. Just swung across the line. Good connection
Yardy to Watson, 1 run punched to cover for one

Yardy to Clarke, 2 runs Clarke is forward, then back as he picks up the length, and nudging down to fine leg ... the throw comes back in very sharply as they come back for the second and is Clarke struggling here? They ask the third umpire to have a look! ... He's safe, but only just
Swann to Watson, no run whipped straight to man inside the circle at midwicket
Swann to Watson, no run tossed up outside off, Watson - on 94 - defends
Swann to Watson, 1 run leg-stump half-volley from Swann, and Watson brings up Australia's 150 with a glance to deep square
Swann to Clarke, no run quicker through the air, off the pad and straight to short fine leg
Swann to Clarke, 1 run Clarke jumps out and aims a wristy drive down to long-on
Swann to Watson, 2 runs worked wide of the midwicket fielder, and the come back for an easy two
Yardy to Clarke, 1 run nudged to square leg, a diving fielder cuts it off but can't stop the single
Yardy to Watson, no run Watson presents the full face of the bat and drives back to the bowler. He deserves a ton here
Yardy to Watson, 1 leg bye off the foot and rolling to Trott at short fine leg
Yardy to Clarke, no run quick and slightly short, Clarke hangs back and drives back to the bowler
Yardy to Clarke, 1 run eased down to long-off for one
Yardy to Watson, no run driven straight to midwicket
Trott to Clarke, 1 run he's full to start, and driven down to long-on
Trott to Watson, 1 run punched in the air down to long-on, another single taken
Trott to Clarke, 1 run nudged just behind square on the leg side, a scrambled one

Trott to Watson, 2 runs popped in the air! But just past Trott outstretched finger-tips, they sprint back for the second and there's the hundred for Watto! What a knock it's been, vital to his team's effort. Off comes the helmet, he's got a smile on his face and you can see how much that means
Trott to Watson, 1 run driven hard down to long-off
Trott to Clarke, 1 run tip-and-run into the covers to end the over
Yardy to Clarke, 1 run Clarke uses his feet and takes the single down to long-on
Yardy to Watson, FOUR runs power! Watson stands tall and absolutely hammers this, sending the ball arcing over Yardy's head and down to the straight boundary
Yardy to Watson, 1 run and he follows that up with a quiet single to long-on, good batting
Yardy to Clarke, no run whipped to midwicket, straight to the fielder
Yardy to Clarke, 1 run very full, Clarke almost yorks himself as he steps out but gets some bat on it to send the ball to short fine leg
Yardy to Watson, 1 run drilled very hard down to long-on, Watson looks like he's itching to step up a gear here
Swann to Watson, no run full, worked to midwicket
Swann to Watson, 1 run driven down to long-on, just the single
Swann to Clarke, no run Clarke charges out of the crease but can't get to the pitch, defending
Swann to Clarke, no run this time he stays back, working to midwicket
Swann to Clarke, 1 run nicely driven down the ground, again just one run
Swann to Watson, 2 runs a tired swipe across the line from Watson, he didn't get the greatest connection but still picks up a run
Yardy to Clarke, 1 run cracked past a diving extra cover, who gets a hand to it but can't stop the single. That sounded like a harder ball off the bat
Yardy to Watson, SIX runs huge! That is a really long boundary, and Watson has cleared it by some distance! It was a touch short and he just rocked back and clubbed it over midwicket

Yardy to Watson, SIX runs another! And this one's even bigger! This time he's on the front foot and slog-sweeping, getting right under it and lofting the ball deep into the crowd. Australia's fans are awake now!
Yardy to Watson, 2 runs he goes for it again, this one is miscued and swirls up into the Melbourne night! But falls safely! Watto can see the funny side
Yardy to Watson, 1 run nudged to fine leg for one
Yardy to Clarke, 1 run single down to long-on
Swann to Clarke, no run quick through the air, this newer ball has some bounce in it and it pops past the outside edge
Swann to Clarke, no run looped up much, much slower this time. Clarke comes down the track and defends back to the bowler
Swann to Clarke, 1 run yet another single from Clarke, down to long-on. What must his wagon-wheel look like...
Swann to Watson, 1 run swept hard by Watson, along the ground and scorching the turf down to long-leg ... but Shahzad is out there and fields cleanly
Swann to Clarke, no run Clarke comes down the track, and drives well down the track but straight back to the bowler
Swann to Clarke, 1 run a touch too short from Swann, Clarke backs away and cuts out to cover point
Tremlett to Clarke, no run back of a length from Tremlett to start, Clarke hops back to defend

Tremlett to Clarke, 4 runs pulled down to Pietersen in the deep ... and what's going on out there? A few moments of utter chaos from England in the field. The original return throw ricocheted off the stumps, and they took an extra two ... and then Bresnan's throw went through Strauss's legs at cover and they took another! Four runs! Tremors isn't happy
Tremlett to Clarke, no run back of a length again, defended to point
Tremlett to Clarke, 2 runs short, pulled in the air well in front of square on the leg side ... the ball plugs on the outfield though, just two
Tremlett to Clarke, no run more length from Tremlett, defence from Clarke, and lots of noise from the crowd!
Tremlett to Clarke, 2 runs shaping away through the air, Clarke steps forward and drives out to the cover sweeper, they take on the fielder and that's good running, he's back safely for two
Swann to Watson, no run huge swipe from Watson, he misses completely and is lucky not to be bowled there! That skidded on, if it had turned he was a goner
Swann to Watson, 2 runs top-edged just over Strauss at short fine leg! That popped off the glove and the England captain leapt up desperately but couldn't get a touch on it
Swann to Watson, 1 run more aggression from Watson, smiting a short one out to deep midwicket
Swann to Clarke, 1 run slashed down behind square on the off side
Swann to Watson, 1 run powerful sweep from Watson, it's in the air for some distance but falls well short of Bresnan in the deep
Swann to Clarke, no run that's gripped and turned! Popping up towards the hip, but negotiated by Clarke. And that ends Swann's contribution with the ball today
Bresnan to Watson, 1 leg bye short to start, Watson attempts a paddle-pull but can't get it away, just the one
Bresnan to Clarke, 1 run short again, pulled out to Pietersen and there's the 100 partnership
Bresnan to Watson, 2 runs muscled out into the leg side
Bresnan to Watson, 1 run short yet again, pulled away and Trott charges round to keep them to one
Bresnan to Smith, no run dabbed down to short third man, Smith is desperate for the single but Watson sends him back just in time
Shahzad to Watson, 1 run crashed firmly down the ground, a superb exhibition of the on-drive ... but it's just one run with the fielder out there

Shahzad to Smith, FOUR runs slower-ball bouncer, a thick edge as Smith flails and the ball evades Davies! He threw everything at it, right off the toe of the bat and down to third man. Australia need more of the same - boundaries that is, not edges!
Shahzad to Smith, 1 run short and fast, pulled away off the front foot to midwicket, just one
Shahzad to Watson, 1 run back of a length, pulled in the air but dropping short of cow corner
Shahzad to Hussey, 1 wide yorker from Shahzad, but flung down the leg side. Hussey loses his footing and falls over
Shahzad to Hussey, 1 run tapped into space at cover, and they take the single
Bresnan to Hussey, 2 runs slower ball from Bresnan, misdirected down the leg side. Hussey glances and, on fresh legs, is back for the second in a flash!

Bresnan to Hussey, FOUR runs half-volley on off stump, and classically driven by Hussey! Didn't try to over-hit it, just stepped forward and presented the face of the bat, bisecting mid-on and mid-off to collect four

Bresnan to Hussey, SIX runs short, pulled, the ball hangs in the air ... and that's landed right on the boundary marker! It was top-edged but there was pace on the ball and he went for it, Hussey is turning it on
Bresnan to Hussey, no run chopped down on the off side, gully dives to save the run
Bresnan to Hussey, 2 runs worked off the hip, Hussey is like lightning between the stumps and is back for the second in quick time! How's Watto doing at the other end? He's blowing a bit...
Bresnan to Hussey, 1 run pushed to wide mid-on, there's a chance for another two if they push hard ... but Watson's knackered and says no

Shahzad to Hussey, no run huge, emotive appeal from Shahzad as Hussey is hit on the pad! But he's the only one to do so, and the umpire isn't interested. But they ask for the review. His foot is behind the line, so that's fine. No bat involved, it appears. But pitching just outside leg, so the decision stands. That was mighty close though!
Shahzad to Hussey, no run cracked very hard into the covers, but that's a great stop by the fielder
Shahzad to Hussey, 2 runs landing on leg stump, Hussey flicks down to fine leg
Shahzad to Hussey, 1 leg bye Shahzad goes full again, has this just come off the pad? They take a run, yep it's a leg bye
Shahzad to Watson, 1 run slower ball, tapped down to gully
Shahzad to Hussey, 1 run another slower ball, pushed towards mid-off and they scamper through
Bresnan to Hussey, no run full toss, slapped back to the bowler who fields in his follow through and hurls a shy at the stumps to send Hussey scampering back to his crease
Bresnan to Hussey, 2 runs whipped well off the toes and out to deep midwicket, just the two runs as a tired Watson sweats the second
Bresnan to White, no run back of a length to start, tapped down to gully
Bresnan to White, 1 run this time he does get the single, down to third man

Bresnan to Watson, 1 wide Bresnan aims for the yorker, but sprays it down the leg side and the umpire signals wide. The bowler isn't happy, he thinks that clipped the pad. Watto is limping though, suggesting he's hit his own ankle with the bat
Bresnan to Watson, no run sharp yorker, and Watson is knocked off his feet! That was quick and right at his toes, Watson jammed down and slipped over as he did so
Yardy to White, no run driven on the up to Bell at cover
Yardy to White, 1 run crunched down to long-off, Watson back on strike
Yardy to Watson, no run fired full and fast at off stump. Medium pace, rather than spin!
Yardy to Watson, 1 run full again, Watson looks for the big shot but can only get one down to long-on. That is, however, his career-best score in ODIs
Yardy to White, 1 run flayed into the covers, Bell gets his hands to it to take the power out of the shot, good effort
Yardy to Watson, no run glanced to short fine leg, straight to the fielder and no run!
Tremlett to White, no run short, White doesn't pick it up and is struck in the midriff as he shapes to pull. That smarts a bit...
Tremlett to White, no run pressure! It's building now, White is struck on the pad as he's beaten by a bit of pace and bounce and is struck on the pad. The ball goes to point, no run
Tremlett to White, 1 run smeared across the line, down to long-on. There's the 250
Tremlett to Watson, 1 run it is full, just outside off, driven hard into the ground and the ball bounces up and over Tremlett (no mean feat) and down to long-off
Tremlett to White, 1 run back of a length again, White swings hard but again it's just one to long-on.
Tremlett to Watson, FOUR runs full, swinging, but the line is wrong and there's the boundary Australia needed! Flicked down to fine leg, the ball beats the fielder at short fine
Bresnan to White, 1 run short, slower-ball bouncer and White pulls out to deep square
Bresnan to Watson, 2 runs full, lifted off the pads and bouncing out to deep midwicket. Shahzad charges round and fires in the return
Bresnan to Watson, 1 run full, close to the yorker but he jams down hard on it and gets the ball down to long-on
Bresnan to White, no run back of a length, White tries to run it down to third man but can't beat the fielder in close.
Bresnan to White, 2 runs slower ball, really quite short and White pulls out into the deep ... they charge back for the second!
Bresnan to White, 1 wide wide! Short again from Bresnan, the quick one this time but ballooning over the batsman and down the leg side

Bresnan to White, (no ball) 1 run no surprises, short again and pulled out into the deep ... and actually Bresnan's been no-balled for this bouncer! It won't be a Free Hit - his front foot was fine - but Bresnan's not happy. He says he wasn't told one for the over
Bresnan to Watson, 2 runs full, straight, clipped and two runs! Good over for Australia
Tremlett to White, 2 runs short, rising on White and he hooks ... the top edge goes miles up, Trott charges in and falls forward, he gets both hands to it but the ball bobbles out!
Tremlett to White, FOUR runs short again, hoicked wildly out to wide long-on, and that's four
Tremlett to White, 1 run the plan may just be misfiring now, White knows it's going to be short every ball and is waiting for it, pulling out to deep square leg
Tremlett to Watson, FOUR runs full, swiped powerfully out to deep midwicket and there's 150 for Watto! His arms are aloft, the crowd cheer their approval and Australia are closing in on the win now
Tremlett to Watson, 1 run again Watson targets midwicket with the lofted shot, this time he doesn't get the best connection but the ball falls short of the fielder out there
Tremlett to White, 1 run short yet again, outside off but White hooks across into the leg side
Shahzad to White, 2 runs full, fast and swinging. The ball takes the inside half of the bat and rolls out on the leg side, and they're back for the second run
Shahzad to White, 1 run White lays bat on ball, tapping towards mid-off and setting off straight away for a scampered single
Shahzad to Watson, no run short, Watson ducks underneath it ... and that's one for the over
Shahzad to Watson, no run pinpoint yorker from Shahzad, and Watson can only dig it out back to the bowler.
Shahzad to Watson, no run full toss, Watson whips into the leg side but hits Strauss at midwicket
Shahzad to Watson, 2 runs slower ball, full outside off and Watson swings it into the leg side ... it won't be the boundary though, Pietersen sprints across to cut it off
Bresnan to White, no run full, right in the blockhole. White slams down on it but mid-on charges round
Bresnan to White, FOUR runs the attempted yorker slips out as a low full toss, and White lifts it to the wide long-on boundary! Is that the blow that puts Australia definitively ahead?
Bresnan to White, no run another great yorker, White digs it out to cover
Bresnan to White, 1 run another full toss, this time White can't capitalise and picks up just one out to deep square
Bresnan to Watson, no run perfect yorker from Bresnan, you simply can't put that away and Watson digs it out to midwicket
Bresnan to Watson, 1 run very full, Watson meets it on the full and powers the ball down to long-on
Shahzad to Watson, SIX runs Watson roars Australia's victory! What a way to do it, a full toss is cracked baseball-style into the crowd behind long-on!

And that is all from your commentary team today. We hope you've enjoyed our coverage, and if you've missed any of the action do have a look at Andrew McGlashan's bulletin. The second game is in Hobart on Friday, see you then!

Australia win by six wickets to take a 1-0 lead in the one-day series, and Shane Watson has been their hero tonight. What an innings it was from him, one of the best one-day innings in recent memory. It was almost a chanceless knock, perfectly-paced and calm under pressure. There was always the feeling that if Australia could get someone to bat through the innings they'd finish on top.
